text: Map of Europe featuring the countries of Northern Europe (highlighted in dark green) Seven United States presidents have made presidential visits to Northern Europe. Richard Nixon became the first incumbent president to visit a Northern European country 1973. The first trips were an offshoot of the general easing of the geo-political tensions between the U.S. and the Soviet Union during the Cold War. To date, every nation in the region has been visited at least once: Finland (6), Denmark (4), Latvia (3), Estonia (2), Iceland (2), Norway (2), Sweden (2), and Lithuania (1). ==Table of visits== {|class="wikitable sortable" |- !President !Dates !Countries !Locations !Key details |- |Richard Nixon | | |Reykjavík |Met with President Kristján Eldjárn and Prime Minister Ólafur Jóhannesson and French President Georges Pompidou. |- |Gerald Ford |nowrap| | |Helsinki |Attended opening session of the Conference on Security and Cooperation in Europe. Met with the Heads of State and Government of Finland, Great Britain, Turkey, West Germany, France, Italy and Spain. Also met with Soviet General Secretary Leonid Brezhnev. Signed the Final Act of the Conference. |- |rowspan=2|Ronald Reagan | | |Reykjavík |Summit meeting with Soviet General Secretary Mikhail Gorbachev. Also met with President Vigdís Finnbogadóttir. |- | |rowspan=3| |rowspan=3|Helsinki |Met with President Mauno Koivisto and Prime Minister Harri Holkeri. |- |nowrap rowspan=2|George H. W. Bush | |Summit meeting with Soviet President Mikhail Gorbachev. Issued joint statement on the Persian Gulf crisis. Also met with President Mauno Koivisto. |- | |Attended Organization for Security and Co- operation in Europe summit meeting. |- |rowspan=4|Bill Clinton | | |Riga |Met with the presidents of the Baltic states. |- | | |Helsinki |Summit meeting with Russian President Boris Yeltsin. Also met with President Martti Ahtisaari. |- | | |Copenhagen |Met with Queen Margrethe II and Prime Minister Poul Nyrup Rasmussen. |- | | |Oslo |State visit. Held discussions with Prime Minister Kjell Magne Bondevik Attended commemorative ceremony for former Israeli Prime Minister Yitzhak Rabin. Met with Russian Prime Minister Vladimir Putin; also met with Palestinian Authority Chairman Yasser Arafat and Prime Minister Ehud Barak of Israel. |- |rowspan="6"|George W. Bush | | |Gothenburg |Attended U.S.-European Union Summit Meeting. Met with King Carl XVI Gustaf and Prime Minister Göran Persson. |- | |nowrap| |Vilnius |Met with the presidents of the Baltic states. |- | | |Riga |Met with the presidents of the Baltic states. |- | | |Kastrup, Fredensborg, Copenhagen |Met with Queen Margrethe II and Prime Minister Anders Fogh Rasmussen. |- | | |Tallinn |Met with President Toomas Hendrik Ilves. |- | |{rowspan="2"| |Riga |Attended the 19th NATO Summit Meeting. |- |rowspan="5"|Barack Obama | | |Copenhagen |Met with Queen Margrethe II and Prime Minister Lars Løkke Rasmussen. Attended the 13th Olympic Congress meeting to lobby for Chicago's bid to host the 2016 Summer Olympics. |- | | |Oslo |Met with King Harald V and Queen Sonja. Received the Nobel Peace Prize. |- | | |Copenhagen |Attended the United Nations Climate Change Conference 2009. |- | | |Stockholm |Met with King Carl XVI Gustaf and Prime Minister Fredrik Reinfeldt. Also met with leaders of the Nordic countries. Attended an event honoring Raoul Wallenberg at the Great Synagogue of Stockholm. |- | | |Tallinn |Met with the presidents of the Baltic states. Visited U.S. and Estonian members of the military. Delivered a speech at Tallinn Airport with Prime Minister Taavi Rõivas. |- |Donald Trump | | |Helsinki |Attended the summit meeting with Russian President Vladimir Putin. Also meet with President Sauli Niinistö. |} ==See also== * Foreign policy of the United States ==References== Category:Denmark–United States relations Category:Finland–United States relations Category:Iceland–United States relations Category:Norway–United States relations Category:Sweden–United States relations Category:Lists of United States presidential visits Category:Estonia–United States relations Category:Latvia–United States relations Category:Lithuania–United States relations
title: United States presidential visits to Northern Europe
